messages.messageBody:

>
it's living your everyday life and forgetting
> the word "lesson". It's
> not a spoonful of sugar to make the medicine go
> down, it's pouring the
> unneeded, mis-prescribed medicine down the sink and
> instead partaking of a
> healthy diet and plenty of exercise.
>
> Live, love, laugh and be happy. Everything else
> falls into place.
>
> Pam

Dar Pam
What a wonderful way to say it!!
Thanks, Sharon

messages.subject: Re: making everyday life NOT school
messages.msgSnippet: ... No, it s living your everyday life and forgetting the word lesson . It s not a spoonful of sugar to make the medicine go down, it s pouring the unneeded,
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1274
>Date: Mon, May 28, 2001, 5:42 PM
>

> So, if I understand unschooling (and I'm sure I don't) it is basically
> making everyday things you do into a "lesson" without ever telling the
> child?


No, it's living your everyday life and forgetting the word "lesson". It's
not a spoonful of sugar to make the medicine go down, it's pouring the
unneeded, mis-prescribed medicine down the sink and instead partaking of a
healthy diet and plenty of exercise.

Live, love, laugh and be happy. Everything else falls into place.

Pam
